wrong_claim: Transclusion described as "Zettelkasten-inspired".
correct_truth: Transclusion inspirations should be listed as Project Xanadu, English Wikipedia, Everything2, and Urticator.net (not Zettelkasten).
source_evidence: gwern-email.txt (Obormot\Arcturus and gwern discussion on transclusion inspiration).

wrong_claim: GTX described as tab-delimited.
correct_truth: GTX is line-based/newline-delimited with records separated by `---`.

wrong_claim: Annotated-link popup flow order is incorrect.
correct_truth: Expected high-level order: extracts -> popups (spawn path) -> transclude -> content -> layout/transclude/rewrite -> popups display -> additional rewrite.
source_evidence: gwern-email.txt (explicit order from Obormot\Arcturus), plus module responsibilities in gwern.net/js/extracts.js, gwern.net/js/popups.js, gwern.net/js/transclude.js, gwern.net/js/content.js, gwern.net/js/layout.js, gwern.net/js/rewrite.js.

wrong_claim: Runtime transforms presented as only ~4 transforms.
correct_truth: Runtime transform system is much larger (roughly 140+ handlers across rewrite/collapse/sidenotes/layout/transclude/extracts modules).
source_evidence: gwern-email.txt ("more like... 150?"), handler registrations across gwern.net/js/rewrite.js and related runtime modules.

wrong_claim: Why client-side enhancement explained only as viewport/preferences/dynamic-state constraints.
correct_truth: Primary reason must include infeasibility of build-time embedding of the transitive closure of linked content (extreme build time/output size), with dynamic-state reasons secondary.
source_evidence: gwern-email.txt (build-time transitive-closure objection) and transclusion/popup runtime architecture in gwern.net/js/transclude.js + related modules.

wrong_claim: Site described as since 2010 / over a decade.
correct_truth: Site history should say active development since January 2009 (~17 years as of 2026).
source_evidence: gwern-email.txt (gwern cites git timestamp: Fri Jan 16 03:59:33 2009).

wrong_claim: PHP Asset Pipeline section omits the pre-commit hook, creating confusion about where build integration lives.
correct_truth: Pre-commit hook should be represented as a first-class build integration component in PHP Asset Pipeline context (or clearly cross-linked there).
source_evidence: gwern-email.txt ("Missing the pre-commit hook from the PHP Asset Pipeline"), docs/overview/component-taxonomy.md:360-376 (pipeline list), docs/overview/component-taxonomy.md:52 (hook currently elsewhere).

wrong_claim: asset.php build integration says pre-commit hook "likely performs" various steps.
correct_truth: asset.php deterministically runs git diff and, when dirty, executes `git add . ; ./build/pre-commit.hook.php | tee -a asset.log`; docs should state this directly without speculative wording.

wrong_claim: Popup flow omits spawn-event details.
correct_truth: Flow should include key spawn-event/notification steps around pop-frame creation so ordering is not misleading.
source_evidence: gwern-email.txt ("missing some spawn event steps"), runtime event flow in gwern.net/js/popups.js and gwern.net/js/initial.js notification center.

wrong_claim: Frontend authorship attribution missing/unclear.
correct_truth: Docs should explicitly credit Said Achmiz as frontend author and link his GitHub profile.
source_evidence: gwern-email.txt (user correction list) and docs/index.md:28 current wording.

wrong_claim: Sidenote positioning: absolute, positioned via `--marginnote-vertical-position` custom property
correct_truth: `#markdownBody .marginnote.sidenote` sets `top/right/left/width` but no `position` is set in `css/initial.css` (so it stays `position: static` unless set elsewhere).

wrong_claim: Outputs `dark-mode-GENERATED.css` with all variables redefined inside `body.dark-mode { ... }`
correct_truth: dark-mode variables are defined under `:root`.

wrong_claim: The dark mode stylesheet has `media=\"not all\"` by default (disabled).
correct_truth: the inlined dark-mode stylesheet defaults to `media=\"all and (prefers-color-scheme: dark)\"`.

wrong_claim: JavaScript toggles the `media` attribute between `all` (active) and `not all` (disabled).
correct_truth: JS uses three states: `auto` -> `all and (prefers-color-scheme: dark)`, `dark` -> `all`, `light` -> `not all`.

wrong_claim: Transforms each color by inverting lightness in HSL, adjusting saturation, and special-casing hues.
correct_truth: conversion uses Lab/YCC/Oklab/Oklch via `CVT` bit-flag transforms, not HSL.

wrong_claim: dark-mode-adjustments.css applies non-color dark mode fixes.
correct_truth: it also sets color variables like `--GW-body-background-color` and `--GW-body-text-color` in `:root`.

wrong_claim: `transition: filter 0s ease 0.25s; /* 250ms delay before restoring */`
correct_truth: transitions are disabled for all `figure img` states (`transition: none`).

wrong_claim: Transitions are disabled for alt-text due to rendering conflicts.
correct_truth: transitions are disabled on `figure img` and hover/invert variants, not just alt-text pseudo-elements.

wrong_claim: This file is conditionally loaded only in dark mode by dark-mode-js via link injection/toggle.
correct_truth: build concatenates `colors-dark-GENERATED.css` + `dark-mode-adjustments.css` into `dark-mode-GENERATED.css`, which is inlined under a `<style>` tag with a media attribute. Sources: `gwern.net/build/build_mode_css.php:19`, `gwern.net/include/inlined-head.html:351`.

wrong_claim: dark-mode-js dynamically enables/disables the filter by setting `--dark-mode-invert-filter`.
correct_truth: dark-mode JS only switches media attribute values; it does not set `--dark-mode-invert-filter`.

wrong_claim: Listeners: None in the codebase currently" (for `Extracts.didLoad`).
correct_truth: `reader-mode.js` registers a handler for `Extracts.didLoad`.

wrong_claim: `popFrameStateLoading(popup)` checks if loading.
correct_truth: the function references `popin` (undefined) instead of `popup`, so it throws rather than checking state.

wrong_claim: GW.contentDidLoad: <transclude -> transclude -> <rewrite -> rewrite -> >rewrite; GW.contentDidInject: <rewrite -> rewrite -> >rewrite -> eventListeners
correct_truth: phase order is defined by `GW.notificationCenter.handlerPhaseOrders` as `["transclude","rewrite"]` for `GW.contentDidLoad` and `["rewrite","eventListeners"]` for `GW.contentDidInject`, implying before/after pseudo-phases for each named phase plus global < and > phases.

wrong_claim: URLs are only archived 60+ days after first being seen.
correct_truth: `manualArchive` archives only items where `(today - firstSeen) < archiveDelay` and excludes 60+ day entries.

wrong_claim: transformURLsForArchiving includes mediumToFreedium -- medium.com -> freedium.cfd.
correct_truth: no Medium rewrite; current transforms include arXiv->PDF, OpenReview->PDF, Reddit->old, x.com->localhost:8081, Fandom->Antifandom, Wayback->if_, GreaterWrong.

wrong_claim: Left Permanent for parse failure (title empty) or PDF URL (skipped).
correct_truth: PDF URLs return `Right (p, ("", "", "", "", [], [], ""))` and are not failures.

wrong_claim: separators: String (4 chars).
correct_truth: `separators` has 3 characters (em dash, middle dot, vertical bar).

wrong_claim: `("A-circumflex + space", " ")` entry shown as `( "A-circumflex + space", " ")`.
correct_truth: entry is A-circumflex followed by a non-breaking space, not a normal space.
replacement is a right single quotation mark (U+2019).

wrong_claim: US inflation spans 1913 to 2023.
correct_truth: `inflationRatesUSD` includes a 2024 rate (`pce2024`) and repeats the last 2024 value forward.

wrong_claim: Bitcoin exchange rates through December 2022.
correct_truth: `bitcoinUSDExchangeRateHistory` ends at `2022-01-01`.

wrong_claim: pce20192023 is repeated forward in inflationRatesUSD.
correct_truth: list includes `pce2024` and repeats the last `pce2024` value.

wrong_claim: Uses GPT-4o to split run-on paragraphs.
correct_truth: `paragraphizer.py` uses `model="gpt-4o-mini"`.

wrong_claim: Each backlink item includes a transclusion directive that loads surrounding context.
correct_truth: only non-author backlinks include `include-block-context-expanded`; author backlinks skip context when `backlinkContextP` is false.

wrong_claim: `testCycleDetection :: [(Int,Int)]((Int,Int).md)`
correct_truth: `testCycleDetection :: [[(Int,Int)]]`.

wrong_claim: nginx.conf is a massive map config with 12,481 redirect rules.
correct_truth: the redirect map is `gwern.net/nginx/redirect/move.conf`, included from `gwern.net/nginx/gwern.net.conf`, and currently has 12,810 entries.

wrong_claim: Size: 12,821 lines.
correct_truth: `move.conf` is 12,836 lines.

wrong_claim: map $request_uri $redirect_uri { include /path/to/redirect/nginx.conf; } ... return 301 $redirect_uri;
correct_truth: map uses `$new_uri` and includes `.../redirect/move.conf`, with redirects via `rewrite ^(.*)$ $new_uri permanent;`.

wrong_claim: When multiple people died on the same date, their names are comma-separated and the script randomly selects one.
correct_truth: duplicate keys overwrite earlier entries; no random selection.

wrong_claim: Sofa block has 90+ randomized link targets.
correct_truth: sofa block has 65 options.

wrong_claim: Remain ignorant button has 16 options.
correct_truth: 17 options.

wrong_claim: Close X button has 7 options.
correct_truth: 9 options.

wrong_claim: `<!--#include virtual="/include/footer.html" -->`
correct_truth: include is `<!--#include virtual="/static/include/footer.html" -->`.

wrong_claim: If no arguments, searches current directory for image files.
correct_truth: auto-discovery matches `*.jpg`, `*.jpeg`, `*.png`, `*.webp`, `*.avif` only (no `*.gif`).

wrong_claim: OPENAI_API_KEY=... python invertornot.py path/to/image.jpg
correct_truth: script ignores argv and always uses hardcoded `image_path`.

wrong_claim: .date-range .subsup sub keeps spacing.
correct_truth: `body.reader-mode-active .date-range sub` sets `display: none`, so spacing is not preserved.

wrong_claim: .reader-mode-style-not * resets all styling (anti-style zone).
correct_truth: only resets `font-weight`, `font-style`, `font-variant`, and `color`.

wrong_claim: File is loaded inline in the <head> as critical CSS.
correct_truth: concatenated into `head-GENERATED.css` and linked via `/static/css/head.css`, not inlined. Sources: `gwern.net/build/build_unified_assets.php`, `gwern.net/build/build_head_includes.php`.

wrong_claim: Returns `/static/{name}{ext}?v={mtime}`.
correct_truth: function returns a quoted string including surrounding double quotes for HTML embedding.

wrong_claim: When spawning a popin from within another popin while content is still loading, the new popin inherits the parent's height.
correct_truth: height inheritance also happens when the new popin is in the loading-failed state (`Popins.popFrameStateLoadingFailed(popin)`).

wrong_claim: When any of these elements becomes fully visible (threshold: 1.0), reader mode deactivates automatically.
correct_truth: only the first matching element is observed because `document.querySelector(...)` is used.

wrong_claim: Parses hex or rgba() color strings into 0-255 RGB and 0-1 alpha (e.g., 0.5 -> 0.5).
correct_truth: `Color.rgbaFromString` uses `parseInt` for all rgba components, so fractional alpha is truncated (0.5 -> 0).

wrong_claim: Halloween always uses dark ... specialClass = `special-halloween-dark`.
correct_truth: Halloween selects `special-halloween-light` or `special-halloween-dark` based on `DarkMode.computedMode()`.

wrong_claim: April Fools does not use a `body.special-april-fools` class.
correct_truth: April Fools adds/removes `special-april-fools` on `<body>`.

wrong_claim: All themes except April Fools replace the site logo.
correct_truth: Easter does not inject a logo (logo injection is commented out); only Halloween and Christmas replace it.

wrong_claim: Halloween sets `DarkMode.defaultMode = \"dark\"`.
correct_truth: it sets `DarkMode.pageDefaultMode = \"dark\"`.

wrong_claim: Matching cascade: exact -> tagsShort2Long -> suffix -> infix -> dot->slash -> edit distance (max 3).
correct_truth: `guessTagFromShort` also tries prefix matches and additional suffix/prefix/infix fallbacks (including against `tagsShort2Long`), and applies both `.`->`/` and `-`->`/` rewrites before edit distance.

wrong_claim: Calls: `./static/build/changeTag` (under `gwtag`).
correct_truth: `gwtag` runs `timeout 20m nice changeTag +RTS -N2 -RTS "$@"` with no `./static/build/` path.

wrong_claim: `echo '"~^{old}$" "{new}";' >> ~/wiki/nginx/redirect/move.conf`
correct_truth: appends to `~/wiki/static/nginx/redirect/move.conf`.

wrong_claim: `gwsed.sh '](old}' ']{new}'`
correct_truth: Markdown link replacement targets `'](old'` -> `'](new'`.

wrong_claim: Writes `linkSuggestions.el` and `linkSuggestions-deleted.hs`.
correct_truth: Elisp output goes to the first CLI argument, and the debug file is written to `metadata/linkSuggestions-deleted.hs`.

wrong_claim: Sort by content length, take smallest (quote) or arbitrary (site).
correct_truth: both quotes and sites select the smallest-length entry (`head $ sortOn length`).

wrong_claim: Regexes exclude currency patterns (USD/EUR/GBP) and require years 1501-2099.
correct_truth: `dateRangeRegex` matches any 4-digit year starting with 1 or 2, only `$` is filtered by a guard; bounds are enforced after matching via `C.minDateFirst`/`C.maxDateSecond`.

wrong_claim: Regex patterns applied before fixed-string rewrites. Currently contains 1 rule.
correct_truth: `htmlRewriteRegexpBefore` contains 2 rules.

wrong_claim: filterURLs blacklists patterns: dropbox.com, harney.com, /doc/*/index.
correct_truth: also blacklists a specific Reuters URL; the Harney rule is an exact prefix for `https://www.harney.com`; and both `/doc/*/index` and `https://gwern.net/doc/*/index` are included.

wrong_claim: Counts similar links by counting link elements in the similar-links snippet.
correct_truth: counts occurrences of the string `class=\"link-annotated id-not backlink-not\"` in the snippet.

wrong_claim: Size: 28,285 lines; Redirect count: 28,006 rules.
correct_truth: `broken.conf` currently runs past line 29,000 (line 29,132 exists), so counts are outdated.

wrong_claim: authorLinkHref is used for the author profile link (href=[author-url]).
correct_truth: template uses `titleLinkHref` for the author link `href`, not `authorLinkHref`.

wrong_claim: Tweet link title uses the tweet URL.
correct_truth: template has a malformed placeholder `<<{tweetLinkHref>>`, so it will not interpolate as documented.

wrong_claim: Critical CSS and JavaScript are inlined in the <head>.
correct_truth: only CSS is inlined; JS is linked via `<script src="/static/js/head.js...">`.

wrong_claim: Inlines CSS and JavaScript into <style> and <script> tags.
correct_truth: inlines only CSS; JS is included via external `<script src=...>` tag.

wrong_claim: Not used for special cases like the 404 error page.
correct_truth: `static/template/default.html` is applied to all `*.md` targets; `error404` is a metadata flag used inside the template.

wrong_claim: `--dry-run` returns a path with no extension.
correct_truth: `--dry-run` returns `doc/www/$DOMAIN/$HASH.html` when no archive exists (or `doc/www/$DOMAIN/$HASH.*` if one does).

wrong_claim: `cat - | ~/wiki/static/build/preprocess-markdown`
correct_truth: calls `preprocess-markdown` from `$PATH`, not a fixed `~/wiki/static/build` path.

wrong_claim: Uses a Perl HTML parser, falling back to xmllint for validation.
correct_truth: it only checks for `xmllint` presence; no `xmllint` validation is used.

wrong_claim: USER_AGENT
correct_truth: no user agent is set in the script.

wrong_claim: Output must contain at least one `\n\n`.
correct_truth: validation only checks for any `\n` (single newline).

wrong_claim: Output cannot exceed 2x original length.
correct_truth: allows up to `2x + 1000` characters.

wrong_claim: Order includes localizeLink before hasAnnotation and addSizeToLinks; addCanPrefetch before imageLinkHeightWidthSet.
correct_truth: in `pandocTransform`, `addSizeToLinks` runs before `hasAnnotation`, `localizeLink` runs after both, and `imageLinkHeightWidthSet` runs before `addCanPrefetch` via `walkM (addCanPrefetch <=< imageLinkHeightWidthSet)`.

wrong_claim: Complete element removal (display: none) includes .date-range sub.
correct_truth: `.date-range sub` is not in the display-none group; `.date-range .subsup sub` is hidden with `visibility: hidden`.

wrong_claim: Takes a list of URLs (typically piped from link-extractor.hs).
correct_truth: `main` ignores stdin and counts all links from the backlinks DB.

wrong_claim: Optional printN argument (defaults to unlimited).
correct_truth: `printN:_ <- getArgs` requires at least one argument and fails on none.

wrong_claim: Called by Annotation.Gwernnet.gwern when path has .pdf extension.
correct_truth: `.pdf` URLs are routed directly by `Annotation.linkDispatcherURL` to `pdf`.

wrong_claim: If PDF lacks title/author/date/DOI, extraction fails permanently.
correct_truth: it returns `Left Permanent` only when all fields are empty; missing files trigger `error`.

wrong_claim: Each metadata field requires a separate exiftool invocation (4 total).
correct_truth: there are 5 `exiftool` calls.

wrong_claim: Header 'Bibliography (N):' always shows N.
correct_truth: count is omitted when `tripletsN < 2`.

wrong_claim: Links without full annotations show as code-styled paths.
correct_truth: if title exists but abstract is empty, entry uses `titlecase'` HTML, not code styling.

wrong_claim: typographyTransformTemporary called by Annotation.hs.
correct_truth: callers are `hakyll.hs`, `generateLinkBibliography.hs`, `generateBacklinks.hs`, and `GenerateSimilar.hs`; `Annotation.hs` does not call it.

wrong_claim: typesetHtmlField called by Annotation.hs.
correct_truth: called by `LinkMetadata.hs` and `XOfTheDay.hs`, not `Annotation.hs`.

wrong_claim: identUniquefy called by generateLinkBibliography.hs and generateBacklinks.hs.
correct_truth: used in `generateDirectory.hs`.

wrong_claim: Prioritize missing embeddings by modification date.
correct_truth: `missingEmbeddings` returns entries missing in embeddings DB with no date ordering; `generateSimilarLinks.hs` uses that list as-is.

wrong_claim: DOI validation: must contain exactly one /.
correct_truth: requires at least one `/` and a digit, not exactly one.

wrong_claim: title-cleaner.py uses GPT-4o-mini and temperature 0.
correct_truth: `title-cleaner.py` uses `model="gpt-5-mini"` and `temperature=1`.

wrong_claim: transformURLsForArchiving includes Medium -> Freedium.
correct_truth: no Medium->Freedium transform exists.

wrong_claim: Always exits 0 (warnings only).
correct_truth: it throws `error` on parse failures and can crash on missing args.

wrong_claim: Inlines all CSS instead of loading via <link>.
correct_truth: still includes external `<link>` tags for `head.css` and `style.css`.

wrong_claim: NCBI/PubMed numeric IDs without /pubmed/ prefix.
correct_truth: the check flags URLs that include `/pubmed/`.

wrong_claim: Temporary uploads auto-delete after 90 days.
correct_truth: script only uploads to `/doc/www/misc/`; no deletion scheduling.

wrong_claim: Exit codes: 2 invalid target dir/guess failed; 3 could not cd; 4 file exists; 10 missing dependencies.
correct_truth: missing deps exit 2; unsupported extension exit 3; dir/guess failure returns 8; cd failures return 4 or 9; exact-path collision returns 10.

wrong_claim: Output format (7 lines, some may be empty).
correct_truth: script outputs 6 lines (title, authors, date, TL;DR, abstract, keywords).

wrong_claim: SSI fragment: static/include/inlined-head-standalone.html.
correct_truth: standalone include file is `static/include/inlined-standalone.html`.

wrong_claim: Exclusively sets CSS custom properties" / "minimal stylesheet (8 lines).
correct_truth: includes a `@media` rule for `.poem` and `.editorial` and is longer than 8 lines.

wrong_claim: For external links, returns the full href.
correct_truth: `Annotations.targetIdentifier` returns the raw `href` attribute for anchor elements (not the resolved full URL); only non-anchors use `target.href`.

wrong_claim: containing 28,822 redirect rules” / “Redirect count: 28,822 rules.
correct_truth: `gwern.net/nginx/redirect/broken.conf` currently has 28,857 quoted map entries (lines like `\"~^//$\" \"/\";` at line 2); the count exceeds 28,822.
`gwern.net/template/pandoc/template-html5-articleedit.html5` uses curly quotes: `q { quotes: "“" "”" "‘" "’"; }` (lines 22–24).

wrong_claim: Invalid output (no breaks, corrupted numbers, too long): Returns ""
correct_truth: `gwern.net/build/paragraphizer.py` exits with error on failed validation (`_looks_ok` false) and does not return an empty string (lines 85–89).

wrong_claim: Too short (< 100 chars): Returns ""
correct_truth: `gwern.net/build/paragraphizer.py` outputs the literal string `"\"\""` and exits for short inputs (lines 60–63).

wrong_claim: moves transform attributes from the root SVG to nested groups
correct_truth: `gwern.net/build/build_icon_sprite_file.php` uses `+` instead of `.` when wrapping `$svg_contents`, so the transform wrap is broken and `$svg_contents` becomes `0` for non-numeric content (lines 71–79).

wrong_claim: --dry-run: Calculate hypothetical path without any I/O
correct_truth: `gwern.net/build/linkArchive.sh` performs filesystem I/O via `ls "doc/www/$DOMAIN/$HASH."*` to detect existing archives before emitting the path (lines 82–87).

wrong_claim: — “The extensive alias tables (~200 entries in `tagsShort2LongRewrites` alone)”
correct_truth: `tagsShort2LongRewrites` currently contains 608 mappings (source: `gwern.net/build/Config/Tags.hs:65` `tagsShort2LongRewrites` list).

wrong_claim: — “Inputs: `static/font/**/*.{otf,ttf}`, `static/font/font_spec.php`, `static/css/*.css`, `static/js/*.js`, … `static/template/include/*.tmpl`”
correct_truth: the script uses `$font_dir`, `$css_dir`, `$js_dir`, `$template_dir` rooted at repo paths `gwern.net/font`, `gwern.net/css`, `gwern.net/js`, `gwern.net/template/include` (source: `gwern.net/build/build_paths.php:3`).

wrong_claim: — “SSI fragments: `static/include/inlined-head.html`, `static/include/body-end.html`, `static/include/inlined-standalone.html`”
correct_truth: includes are written under `gwern.net/include` (e.g., `{$include_dir}/inlined-standalone.html`) (source: `gwern.net/build/build_paths.php:11`, `gwern.net/build/build_standalone_includes.php:84`).

wrong_claim: — “static assets (icons, logos, fonts)”
correct_truth: the script versions `icons.svg`, logo images, and dropcap images only; it does not include font files (source: `gwern.net/build/build_asset_versions.php:10`).

wrong_claim: — “`$value_regexp` … to match numeric coordinate values within path data”
correct_truth: the regex only matches non‑negative numbers, so negative coordinates are not rounded (source: `gwern.net/build/svg_squeeze.php:8`).
